p: Currently, there exists a vast literature that includes the compound chitosan (poly-D-glucosamine) which is the result of extensive deacetylation of the polymer chitin (N-acetyl chitosan) as an effective antimicrobial compound. Its barrier effects, antimicrobial characteristics and mode of action against a wide range of plant pathogenic fungi and bacteria, and on foodborne pathogens is well recognized ( Rodríguez-Pedroso et al., 2009; Romanazzi et al., 2017). On this, its fungicidal properties include fungi belonging to the families Mucoraceae ( Rhizopus stolonifer), Sclerotinicaeae ( Botrytis cinerea, Sclerotinia sclerotiorum), Trichocomaceae ( Penicillium digitatum, P. expansum), and Pleosporaceae ( Alternaria alternata), among others ( Gutiérrez-Martínez et al., 2017).
